boat.name: Mary Ellen
boat.full_description:
From 1946 - 1953 Major 'Spider' Dale kept 'Mary Ellen' at Walton, selling her to Lester and Muriel Cole who sailed out of Burnham and kept her for 20 years, sailing her to Finland in 1969.

Michael Marbell kept her at Bosham until she changed hands again in 1980. Her new owner, William Phillips took her to Chichester, selling her in 1987 to Charles Vicker who kept her for three years before selling to Robert Vestentoft also of Birdham Pool, who kept her until 2000.

Her original rig was probably gaff but 'Mary Ellen' was Bermudan since the war until being re-rigged gaff in 2001 with mast by Priors and sails by Lawrence.
boat.construction_details: Carvel pitch pine on double sawn oak
boat.short_description: 'Mary Ellen' was built in 1934 by Kidby and Sons, Brightlingsea, Essex. As builders of fast smacks they built her to their own design as a gentleman's yacht for a local farmer. Her hull takes the shape of an Essex smack, but with a spoon bow and transom stern. She has been cruised extensively.
